model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: I just got back from my trip to South America. It was amazing!

[MEMORY]
1. Neighbors A and B both took a cooking class together last year.
2. Neighbors A and B believe in doing nice things for others to bring the community together.
3. Both Neighbors A and B believe in the importance of learning and self-improvement.
4. Neighbors B admires Neighbors A's organization skills and wishes to improve their own organization.
5. Neighbors B remembers the incident.
6. Neighbors A saw George at the store and exchanged waves.
current_dialogue: Neighbors A: I just got back from my trip to South America. It was amazing!

raw_prediction: That sounds like an incredible experience! Did you take any cooking classes while you were there? I remember how much you enjoyed the one we did together last year.
